column4: gents my apt-get has died - i am getting "unknown error executing gpgv" when using apt-get update
Is your system date correct http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=271904
time is fine
I'm performing an update as we speak just fine.
When you say time I presume you've checked the date as well.
yup
Does /usr/bin/gpgv exist?
yes
Can you try running "sudo aptitude update" at the command prompt and pastebining any errors you get.
Can you also paste bin your sources /etc/apt/sources.list
I've found this which maybe of interest to you http://www.unix.com/ubuntu/123074-cant-update-use-package-manager-gpg-error-2.html
cant see a real solution there for me, so i will just download the sio and update the OS from that!

As far as I can gather the solution was/is to recompile that package from source and then perform an update.  However I can understand you might not be comfortable with that and in honesty I'd do it on my own machine but I'm not comfortable enough to guide you through it on your machine.
yeah thanks... where would i even begin to find the source files?
screw it ill give it a go!
I've found a copy at ftp://ftp.cwru.edu/pub/bash/readline-6.1.tar.gz but I'm not sure if it's the best place from which to get it.
got one, ran ./configure, and make, looks all fine... now what?
Try your "sudo aptitude update" again
no joy. do i need to move the newly "make'd" file? or does it install it directly as part of the process/
make install often installs it
ok that worked, but update doesnt! ;(
Sorry wookienz that and the incorrect date are the only two causes I'm aware of.
right o thanks. ISO comgin down in abut 10 mins so ill install of that
Best of luck and at least you had a go which is often half the battle.
